reviews.sentence: Emergency trip to Phily. This hotel is dated and the rooms need revamped. The bedding is not the normal Hampton Quality. Hotel is located by A very busy highway with a lot of road noise. Staff as very helpful rates are normal for the area.
Excellent. The facility could be updated it is definitely showing age. I did however hear talk of renovations from the staff. that is a plus.

Just bad all around. As a business traveler who exclusively stays at Hilton properties I can say without a doubt that this was the worst yet. The customer service was non existent the rooms are disgusting and the AC simply did not work properly. When I asked the front desk about the AC I was told there was nothing they could do about it. I get it they are under renovation but that is no excuse for poor service. It is a shame as I travel there often but will choose somewhere else next time. Traveler be warned find somewhere else as many options are available in that area.

Filthy terrible service and no one cares. The Hampton Inn brand is being damaged by this place. Even though renovations are in process there is no excuse for the way this place is being run. The breakfast is terrible coffee urns unfilled juice machine pumping water and dirty tables. The trash barrels are overflowing and there is no management oversight. In my last 3 stays there the hot water was shut off in error my room went un serviced the lights over the vanity in the bathroom were burnt out the clock was defective and the TV remote did not work. I only stay here because of location but will stop. I can not understand how they can raise the prices each week during this disastrous period. It has gone from 12 for AAA to 146. It is not worth 790Someone from Corporate needs to visit this place.
Near good shopping. Needs remodel. I think the remodel is underway and it is needed.
Fair. hotel was at renovation and it was not good.

Stay Away. Although the website said that the hotel was under renovation of their guest rooms I thought it was fine to stay but I was so wrong. When we checked in I noticed the complimentary coffee tea service to the side of the front desk which I thought was nice but soon I quickly discovered that it was not just meant for guests. There were often various hotel employees that would utilize the coffee or tea for themselves. I thought this was for the GUESTS. As we make our way to the elevator my family and I were constantly sneezing from the dust that the construction people made as they haul materials and cement into the elevator that took us up to the floor. Inside the rooms were musty and smells of moisture. The size of the room was small and tight but the bathroom was spacious. The best part of the stay was the shower water pressure. Unfortunately the hotel did not provide enough towel service for a family of four. I then picked up the telephone to request for more towels and I discovered that the in room telephone was not working. So I made my way downstairs to request for more towels from the front desk which we never received from the staff. We waited the next morning to get more towels from the housekeeping staff in the hallway. At our complimentary breakfast the hotel only provide one waffle maker which is slow and always had a line of people waiting to use it. By the time breakfast was ending there were guests that were still waiting to use it. The staff quickly came out to clean up everything and took food away. It is absolutely awful to stay in a hotel that does not make guests feel the comfort of home. The front desk staffs are also unfriendly no hellos or welcome when guests enters the hotel. The entire staff and management should be renovated and retrain for hotel and hospitality service. If you plan to stay in this property I recommend that you stay away and go for other chain of hotels than to waste your time and money in this location.

Worst HIlton Property. Renovations were happening at the property which I understand it being a little messy. However the place is very rough unclean and there was no hot water for morning shower. The gym stinks. Do yourself a favor and find a different Hilton property.

King of Prussia Nightmare. Hotel was being remodeled during my stay which it sorely needed. I would not recommend this hotel except perhaps to an ex spouse after a bitter divorce. The hotel was dusty dirty cold and should have been closed during the project. The parking lot was full of construction materials trucks cranes etc. which made parking a challenge if you wish to protect your vehicle from damage associated with such a busy time. Only one elevator was working and it took forever to arrive. Once inside it too was dirty and damaged by all the transporting of construction material. Several ice machines were out of service. Avoid the location for several months. There were no discounts offered for suffering through their needed transformation.

Staff not concerned for the guests. the location is close to King of Prussia Mall which is a bonus and primary reason why we booked it when Crowne was full that night. it is clean and has hydrationcofe site. With the renovation happening in hotel the staff did not notify us and put us in a floor directly one floor below a renovation site. The noise destroyed our rest starting 9 am. The front desk refused to move the renovation to another room first.

Newly renovated. Newly renovated rooms and are very nice. Breakfast was good. It was difficult to enter the hotel off the road have to go past it and turn around to enter the hotel. Close to king of prussia mall and next to a gas station.

The front desk staff was extremely welcoming and helpful. Although the hotel was not updated overall the sleeping rooms were very nice. There was a surprising amount of highway noise inside the room with the window tightly shut it did not open.

Not up to Hilton standards. My wife and I spent a weekend at this hotel in Sept 2017. Undergoing lots of renovations. maybe short staffed. Too many details to mention but bottom line this place is not up to Hilton standards at any level service staff facilities food and beverage housekeeping parking etc. I have been staying at Hilton properties for 20 years including many Hampton Inns. Very disappointed in our stay. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Maybe they will get it together after renovations complete.

Dirty elevator. Room extremely stuffy non operable windows throughout the building is not healthy. Breakfast advertised until 10AM. Staff was clearing buffet at 940. Trays were empty and patrons expressed dissatisfaction. Staff was friendly but facility needs makeover and requires ventilation. Mattresses worn.
Absolutely great experience. All of the staff was friendly the suites and decor is updated and fresh and the beds are amazing.

KOP visit 2017. Great visit to this site from start to finish. Staff was very helpful and attentive. Very good hot breakfast options daily. Convenient location close to King of Prussia mall. Newly renovated rooms are very comfortable.

AVOID. We stayed here prior the remodel and had no issues. This time it was bad. Erichp85 is definitely on target in saying this is a substandard Hilton property. Some examples1. The window shade was stuck halfway down. I could not budge it. The cover for the shade roller was leaning in the corner2. The bathroom door and the closet door on the same. It slides back and forth. Only one can be closed at a time. And there is no lock on it3. The sliding shower door opens only on the wall side so you have to slither past the toilet to get in and out of the shower4. there is a recessed can light over the toilet but there is no switch for it. Not that it mattered as there was no light bulb in it5. Our room was prepaid through Hilton Honors but we had to leave a card for incidentals. When I got my credit card bill I was surprised to see the local hotel charged me again. I am still waiting for this to get resolved.

Welcoming Check in. Ms Tanya is a lovely clerk she beat my expectations when it comes to front desk personality from 0 10. She is highly Professional Friendly and outgoing. The fact that she helped me out by giving me the complete information about tourist sight around the area of king of Prussia. She cared about my needs as well as a guest. She holds a great character of a front desk with that being said I adore her to the fullest. Room are fantastic and clean Hallway are well maintained smell fineBreakfast just a norm but well keptBeds are comfortable Bathroom 5Star brand new renovated Carpet inside the room extremely clean.

BUSINESS STAY. Okay stay newly renovated good night sleep for work trip. Complimentary breakfast. Near mall. Elevator extremely slow. Complimentary coffee and tea in lobby. Decent fitness center. albeit small. Good for business stay.

Close to the mall. Ask for a room facing Dekalb Pike to avoid some of the noise from the interstate. A traveling companion said she had a lot of noise but I did not notice it on my side of the hotel. Staff was very friendly. Typical Hampton Inn breakfast was good. Looks like this location was renovated recently. The room was very nice. Only negative comment is that when I returned to my room a dirty towel was laying on my bed. No bathmat replacement for the dirty one. Hampton beds are always very comfortable. I noticed some previous comments regarding the U turn to get to the hotel. It is unfortunate but I see where it would be hazardous if you could turn left into the lot. was not a huge deal for us. We took the next left turn and turned around. Many stores and restaurants in the area.
